humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, multiple sentinel lymph nodes (Nos. 1, 2, and 3) were excised and examined, and no tumor was found in any of them. This is confirmed by both H&E impression and immunohistochemical cytokeratin stain. Therefore, based on the new rules 10 and 11, the N stage for this patient is N0, indicating no metastatic carcinoma in sentinel lymph nodes and regional lymph nodes or that all assessed lymph nodes are negative for metastatic carcinoma.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that multiple (3) left axillary sentinel lymph nodes were negative for tumor (AJCC pNO(i-)). This indicates that there is no evidence of cancer in the lymph nodes, which corresponds to an N0 stage.
